inbodydescription.para: We want to keep going as long as we have something to feed the resampler with OR as long as the resampler spews out samples (which could continue for a few iterations after we stop feeding it)

memberdef.argsstring: (samplePtr buffer, sampleFormat format, sampleCount start, sampleCount len) const
memberdef.name: GetSamples

memberdef.argsstring: (samplePtr buffer, sampleFormat format, sampleCount start, sampleCount len)
memberdef.name: SetSamples

detaileddescription.para: WaveTrack calls this whenever data in the wave clip changes. It is called automatically when WaveClip has a chance to know that something has changed, like when member functions SetSamples() etc. are called.

briefdescription.para: Create clip from copy, discarding previous information in the clip.

memberdef.argsstring: (WaveDisplay &display, double t0, double pixelsPerSecond, bool &isLoadingOD) const
memberdef.name: GetWaveDisplay

detaileddescription.para: Getting high-level data from the for screen display and clipping calculations and Contrast

memberdef.argsstring: (WaveTrackCache &cache, const float *&spectrogram, const sampleCount *&where, int numPixels, double t0, double pixelsPerSecond) const
memberdef.name: GetSpectrogram

detaileddescription.para: Whenever you do an operation to the sequence that will change the number of samples (that is, the length of the clip), you will want to call this function to tell the envelope about it.

memberdef.argsstring: (samplePtr buffer, sampleFormat format, sampleCount len, unsigned int stride=1, XMLWriter *blockFileLog=NULL)
memberdef.name: Append

briefdescription.para: You must call Flush after the last Append.
Flush must be called after last Append.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxString &fName, sampleCount start, sampleCount len, int channel, bool useOD)
memberdef.name: AppendAlias

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxString &fName, sampleCount start, sampleCount len, int channel, int decodeType)
memberdef.name: AppendCoded

detaileddescription.para: This name is consistent with WaveTrack::Clear. It performs a "Cut" operation (but without putting the cutted audio to the clipboard)

briefdescription.para: Clear, and add cut line that starts at t0 and contains everything until t1.
Paste data from other clip, resampling it if not equal rate.

detaileddescription.para: Insert silence - note that this is an efficient operation for large amounts of silence

briefdescription.para: Get access to cut lines list.

detaileddescription.para: Find cut line at (approximately) this position. Returns true and fills in cutLineStart and cutLineEnd (if specified) if a cut line at this position could be found. Return false otherwise.
Expand cut line (that is, re-insert audio, then DELETE audio saved in cut line). Returns true if a cut line could be found and sucessfully expanded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Remove cut line, without expanding the audio in it.
Offset cutlines right to time 't0' by time amount 'len'.
Delete the wave cache - force redraw. Thread-safe.
Adds an invalid region to the wavecache so it redraws that portion only.
This allows multiple clips to be a part of one WaveTrack.
